intro: Diogenesia racemosa, commonly known as the clustered diogenesia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Diogenesia racemosa is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
